<div class="fl-module fl-module-pp-heading fl-node-5d53fa3d9f14e" data-node="5d53fa3d9f14e">
	<div class="fl-module-content fl-node-content">
		<div class="pp-heading-content">
		<div class="pp-heading  pp-left">

		<h3 class="heading-title">

			
			<span class="title-text pp-primary-title">What is TCF v2.0?</span>
			
			
		</h3>

	</div>
				<div class="pp-sub-heading">
			<p><span style="font-weight: 400;">IAB Europe, in partnership with IAB Tech Lab, </span><strong><a href="https://iabeurope.eu/press-releases/iab-europe-iab-tech-lab-release-updated-transparency-consent-framework/">announced</a></strong><span style="font-weight: 400;"> on </span><b>21 August 2019</b><span style="font-weight: 400;"> the launch of the second iteration of Transparency and Consent Framework (TCF) v2.0.</span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">The TCF Steering Group (SG) was tasked with drafting the new TCF Policy and IAB Tech Lab managed the technical specifications. With participation from 10 National IABs and 55 organisations, and EU-level associations, publishers, media owners, technology providers, and media agencies, the TCF Steering Group enabled an inclusive, fair and consensus-based participation of stakeholders to deliver the vision.</span></p><p><b>TCF v2.0 </b><span style="font-weight: 400;">continues to support the overall drive of the TCF to increase consumer transparency and choice, management by digital properties of consent and compliance, and industry collaboration that centres on standardisation.Â </span></p><p><span style="color: #6d1afe; font-size: 30px;"><b>Why Work with TCF v2.0?</b></span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">TCF v2.0 enables consumers to grant or withhold consent and also exercise their â€˜right to objectâ€™ to data being processed. Consumers also gain more control over whether and how vendors may use certain features of data processing, for example, the use of precise geolocation.</span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">Publishers employing TCF v2.0 gain greater control and flexibility with respect to how they integrate and collaborate with their technology partners. New publisher functionality allows them to restrict the purposes for which personal data is processed by vendors on a publisherâ€™s website on a per-vendor basis.</span></p><p><span style="font-size: 30px; color: #6d1afe;"><strong>TCF v2.0 Support Materials & Marketing Collateral</strong></span></p><p><span style="font-weight: 400;">To help stakeholders successfullyÂ  implement </span><a href="https://iabeurope.eu/iab-europe-iab-tech-lab-release-updated-transparency-consent-framework/"><span style="font-weight: 400;">TCF v2.0</span></a>, we have prepared marketing materials and collaterals to provide a clear overview of the framework, its mechanism, and what it entails for all stakeholders involved. From videos to handy guides, you will find everything you need below to get more familiar with TCF v2.0 and its latest updates. You can access all materialsÂ <a href="https://iabeurope.eu/knowledgehub/policy/iab-europe-transparency-and-consent-framework/tcf-v2-0-support-materials-marketing-collateral/" target="_blank" rel="noopener" data-saferedirecturl="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://iabeurope.eu/knowledgehub/policy/iab-europe-transparency-and-consent-framework/tcf-v2-0-support-materials-marketing-collateral/&source=gmail&ust=1590221091430000&usg=AFQjCNEyttXHAb0OAmY83E5S2Fn5EN_H2w">here</a>.</p><p><span style="font-weight: 400;"> <span style="font-size: 30px; color: #6d1afe;"><strong>FAQ Document on the APD Decision</strong></span></span></p><p>The Belgian Data Protection Authority (APD) handed down on 2 February 2022 a decision on the Transparency & Consent Framework (TCF). This <a href="https://iabeurope.eu/wp-content/uploads/2022/03/IAB-Europe-APD-FAQ_v3.docx.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><strong>FAQ document</strong></a> offers further information on what this decision actually says, and what it means for the Transparency and Consent Framework (TCF) itself and for IAB Europe, vendors, publishers, and consent management platforms (CMPs).</p><h3>Technical specifications</h3><div dir="ltr"><div><strong><a readabilityObject.title: TCF v2.0 â€“ IAB Europe
readabilityObject.content:
IAB Europe, in partnership with IAB Tech Lab, announced on 21 August 2019 the launch of the second iteration of Transparency and Consent Framework (TCF) v2.0.

The TCF Steering Group (SG) was tasked with drafting the new TCF Policy and IAB Tech Lab managed the technical specifications. With participation from 10 National IABs and 55 organisations, and EU-level associations, publishers, media owners, technology providers, and media agencies, the TCF Steering Group enabled an inclusive, fair and consensus-based participation of stakeholders to deliver the vision.

TCF v2.0 continues to support the overall drive of the TCF to increase consumer transparency and choice, management by digital properties of consent and compliance, and industry collaboration that centres on standardisation. 

Why Work with TCF v2.0?

TCF v2.0 enables consumers to grant or withhold consent and also exercise their â€˜right to objectâ€™ to data being processed. Consumers also gain more control over whether and how vendors may use certain features of data processing, for example, the use of precise geolocation.

Publishers employing TCF v2.0 gain greater control and flexibility with respect to how they integrate and collaborate with their technology partners. New publisher functionality allows them to restrict the purposes for which personal data is processed by vendors on a publisherâ€™s website on a per-vendor basis.

TCF v2.0 Support Materials & Marketing Collateral

To help stakeholders successfully  implement TCF v2.0, we have prepared marketing materials and collaterals to provide a clear overview of the framework, its mechanism, and what it entails for all stakeholders involved. From videos to handy guides, you will find everything you need below to get more familiar with TCF v2.0 and its latest updates. You can access all materials here.

FAQ Document on the APD Decision

The Belgian Data Protection Authority (APD) handed down on 2 February 2022 a decision on the Transparency & Consent Framework (TCF). This FAQ document offers further information on what this decision actually says, and what it means for the Transparency and Consent Framework (TCF) itself and for IAB Europe, vendors, publishers, and consent management platforms (CMPs).

Technical specifications
